holidays.name: Embrace Your Geekness Day
holidays.description: A day to proudly celebrate all things nerdy and geeky ‚Äî from comic books and video games to science fiction and technology.
holidays.origin: Created by geek culture enthusiasts to encourage self-expression and pride in niche interests.
holidays.funFact: The word 'geek' once was an insult meaning a carnival performer who did bizarre acts ‚Äî now it's a badge of honor!

holidays.name: National French Fry Day
holidays.description: A tempting food holiday dedicated to celebrating the beloved crispy, golden French fry in all its forms.
holidays.origin: Borne out of America's love for fast food and all things potato, this day honors the French fry's unmatched popularity.
holidays.funFact: Despite the name, many believe French fries actually originated in Belgium, where fried potatoes were a staple since the late 1600s.

holidays.name: Fortune Cookie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the quirky cookie that delivers a message (and sometimes a puzzle) after your meal!
holidays.origin: Attributed to Californian Chinese restaurateurs in the early 20th century, though the exact origins are debated.
holidays.funFact: Fortune cookies were popularized in San Francisco and Los Angeles long before becoming a staple in Chinese restaurants nationwide.

holidays.name: International Kissing Day
holidays.description: A charming and sweet holiday that encourages you to celebrate affection and the simple joy of a kiss in all its forms.
holidays.origin: Started by face-to-face greeting advocates who believe a kiss reduces stress and strengthens bonds.
holidays.funFact: Kissing releases a cocktail of chemicals including oxytocin, which helps strengthen emotional bonds!
